sentences: Raadio on persses – ei tee piuksugi.
Pedaalid on terved, aga kodarad on täitsa persses.
context: Perses is the inessive singular form of 'perse' (ass/bottom), used colloquially to describe something that is broken, ruined, in a hopeless condition, or completely messed up. It can refer to physical objects that don't work, situations that are impossible, or states of being like being broke or stuck.
